ASPEN ADF Faces Release Notes

  • Announcements
  • New in this Release
  • New in previous 12.1 releases
  • Known Bugs and Limitations
  • Help

Announcements

  • Going forward alta skin will be the default skin supported and Skyros skin is deprecated. We recommend applications on skyros skin versions to migrate to alta skin versions which is a fully redesigned, better looking and functioning UI design with a simpler mobile first layout approach. Applications built using Alta UI is more conducive to responsive design techniques and comes with minimal chrome, fewer nested borders and lines. Less chrome means faster loading of the page.
  • Deploying your application to a reserved port number Ensure that you avoid reserved port numbers when deploying your application. Some application servers will fail to prevent you from deploying your application on a reserved server port (e.g. 1, 7, 9, 11, 13, 15, 17, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, 25, 37, 42, 43, 53, 77, 79, 87, 95, 101, 102, 103, 104, 109, 110, 111, 113, 115, 117, 119, 123, 135, 139, 143, 179, 389, 465, 512, 513, 514, 515, 526, 530, 531, 532, 540, 556, 563, 587, 601, 636, 993, 995, 2049, 3659, 4045, 6000, 6665, 6666, 6667, 6668, 6669). If you use one of these reserved ports, some web browsers may honor it but at least WebKit-based browsers (e.g. Safari and Google Chrome) will not. You may see some page content but all resources (images and styles) will fail to load.
  • JSF 2 component EL usage will interfere with declarative components - By default, JDev has been adding the componentVar="component" attribute as a default to page templates and declarative components. In JSF 2, "component" is a reserved EL variable used to reference the current component. As a result, any existing declarative components or page templates that utilize the componentVar and have the value set to "component" will not function when run in JSF 2. Declarative component authors will need to refactor their templates and declarative components to use a different name for the componentVar.
  • Change to backing bean scope The backing bean scope has been changed from being tied to the client ID to the component itself. The use of client IDs was resulting in the un-intended behavior of having multiple beacking beans being used when include components (declarative component, page template) were placed inside of an iterator. Since this behavior was not intended, the scope is now tied to a component instance. This means that now, if an include component is placed in an <af:iterator/>, only one backing bean scope is created.

    Due to this having the possibility of regression in applications, a temporary, internal switch, is being supported until applications can switch over to the new behavior. This switch should only be used by applications that have an issue with the new code. This will be the case if an application is developed in such a way that data is stored into the backing bean scope per stamp of an iterating component. Normally this will not be the case. To temporarily revert to the old behavior the "oracle.adfinternal.view.rich.BACKING_BEAN_SCOPE_KEY" system property may be set to "clientId"

    Example java argument passed to WLS: -Doracle.adfinternal.view.rich.BACKING_BEAN_SCOPE_KEY=clientId

    This flag will be removed in future versions, so if you are relying on it, you will need to update your application to adopt the new behavior.

  • Change to af:setPropertyListener/af:setActionListener and command's actionListener execution order in Facelets In JSP, the af:setPropertyListener and af:setActionListener tags are called before the command's actionListener. In Facelets, the opposite happened. In 12.1.2.0 we changed the Facelets code so that it works now the same as JSP always has. We don't expect this change to affect many, since Facelets support is fairly new in ADF Faces, and this use case where the Facelet's ordering was desired probably didn't exist for app developers. 

    <af:button actionListener="{#someListener}"><af:setPropertyListener ...></af:button>
    For more information, see Bug 12908218 - for facelet pg, value set in setpropertylistener not available in backing bean
  • Skinning now has versioning

    The Skin Framework now supports versioning. If you create skins, then you can add skin versions to your skins, so you can keep the skin-family name the same between versions. You create skins in trinidad-skins.xml, and you can add a version to your skin. 

    <skin><id>purple-v2.desktop</id><family>purple</family><version><name>v2</name></version>...</skin>
    You can also set 
    <default>
    (child of version) to true if you want that version to be the default skin, the skin that is picked when no skin-version is specified in trinidad-config.xml.

    In trinidad-config.xml, you can specify the skin-family and skin-version, like 

    <skin-family>purple</skin-family><skin-version>v2</skin-version>
    The skin with matching skin-family and skin-version will be picked, or the best match if an identical match cannot be found.
  • fusion-11.1.2.0 and fusion-11.1.1.4.0 skins have been renamed If you used the unreleased skins "fusion-11.1.2.0.desktop" or "fusion-11.1.1.4.0.desktop", these have been renamed. The skin-id "fusion-11.1.2.0.desktop" is "fusionFx-v2.desktop" and "fusion-11.1.1.4.0.desktop" is "fusionFx-v1.desktop". You would have set these skin-ids in trinidad-skins.xml. The skin-family "fusion-11.1.2.0" is now "fusionFx" with "v2" as the skin-version. The skin-family "fusion-11.1.1.4.0" is now "fusionFx" (no version). You would have set the skin-family in trinidad-config.xml.
  • Version 2 of the fusionFx Skin There is now a new version of the fusionFx skin available: skin-family: "fusionFx" and skin-version: "v2". The skin id is "fusionFx-v2.desktop". It has an improved design over the original "fusionFx" look and feel (for example you will see an improved font display for Linux machines where many of the common font families are not available by default, the top portion of panelBox components will now blend identically with the center portion regardless of whether the header is enabled). If you would like to use "fusionFx" version "v2", you may select it in your trinidad-config.xml file by specifying 
    <skin-family>fusionFx</skin-family><skin-version>v2</skin-version>
    Note: In trinidad-config.xml, if you set skin-family to fusionFx, and do not set the skin-version, you will get by default the fusionFx-v1.desktop skin. You can learn more about our skinning framework on this wiki.
  • Custom Skin Developers and the fusionFx-v2 Skin If you extended either the "fusion.desktop", "fusion-11.1.1.3.0.desktop", or "fusionFx-v1.desktop" skins you may now want to instead extend the "fusionFx-v2.desktop" skin to inherit from its improved design. To do so, open up trinidad-skins.xml and change your custom skin from using 
    <extends>fusion.desktop</extends>
    or 
    <extends>fusionFx-v1.desktop</extends>
    to 
    <extends>fusionFx-v2.desktop</extends>
  • Projector Skins If you would like to view your application on a projector, you can use the provided projector skins. You can download the adf-projector-skin-11.jar and include it on your classpath. Once you do that, the new projector skins are available for you to use. To use them, you will set the trinidad-config.xml's skin-family element to point to the projector skin. The projector skins we have for you to choose from are: fusion-projector, fusion-11.1.1.3.0-projector, fusionFx-projector, and fusionFx-projector version v2.
  • Supported Browsers See the full list of supported browsers here.
  • testId and customizationId customizationID and testID attributes are deprecated from the ADF Faces components. The component id will now always be set with a value by the DT removing the need for these two additional attributes. The majority of the changes will be transparent to the ADF Faces Rich Client consumers, but there is a requirement to run the DT page migrator and there are some action items that may affect some but not all consumers. While the page migration task is required, it can be done when the application is ready. In addition, MDS is smart enough to look for the customizationID if the componentID is null, thus preserving backward compatibility for existing customizations. For full details of the changes and steps required by consumers, please refer to this wiki (http://aseng-wiki.us.oracle.com/asengwiki/display/ASDevADFFaces/Instructions+For+Consumers+-+Proposal+5).
  • skin-selectors documentation - Please see the ADF Faces Skinning Selectors document that describes the public skinning selectors.
  • New Window Detection Support This feature allows ADF to manage model states correctly when end users open a new window using Ctrl+N from their application, press the refresh button on their browser toolbar (i.e. F5), copy and paste a URL for an ADF Faces app from one window to another, or use the ADF Dialog Framework to open a new browser window.
  • MIME multipart/related Email type If you use the email mode to render your page in emailable html (e.g., css is inline instead of an external stylesheet because email clients do not load external stylesheets), you probably know that all URLs in the page are absolute URLs. If you want to view the email offline, then you need to convert the HTML into MIME-format, and inline the images. Now we do that for you if you add this request parameter: org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.agent.email=true&oracle.adf.view.rich.render.emailContentType=multipart/related
  • Detecting Unstable Component Structures
    Many of the layout container components in ADF Faces must loop over their children components two or more times in order to produce the desired layout structures. In JSF, it is illegal to change the component tree on the fly during the render phase of the lifecycle. Such illegal changes could be performed by adding components, removing components, changing variables behind EL expressions assigned to the components (e.g. the "rendered" attribute), or using non-thread-safe EL (e.g. a variable shared among multiple users). If the component tree changes between the various passes that a container makes over its children, you may encounter various undesirable results.
    Common symptoms of such illegal changes include:
    • IndexOutOfBoundsException messages in the log files
    • Invalid HTML generated for the browser
    • Mismatching content displayed in the browser (e.g. top tabs of a panelTabbed not matching bottom tabs)
    In this release, there is a debugging tool to help gather more information about these errors in multi-pass container components (e.g. panelGridLayout, panelGroupLayout, menuBar, toolbar, etc.). When enabled via the following web.xml setting, any time a user reproduces the issue, a detailed report will be logged. This report will identify the container component's client ID and the list of rendered child component client IDs that it encountered during each pass. This detailed log report can then be given to the application developer for evaluation. It will tell the application developer which children components are unstable; it will help identify what kind of fix is needed to correct the issue.
                <context-param>
              <param-name>oracle.adf.view.rich.MULTI_PASS_CONTAINER_DEBUG</param-name>
              <param-value>detailed</param-value>
            </context-param>
  • Removed deprecated AFVisualRoot styleclass The deprecated AFVisualRoot styleclass has been removed from our simple skin file. Please refer to the geometry management section of the component tagdoc for the correct way to stretch components.
  • Automation mode and JSF ProjectStage To overcome potential security issues, ADF application can't be used in Production environment with automation enabled. The application will fail to load with an exception when this configuration is set. So make sure to not have automation enabled by default since the default value of JSF ProjectStage is Production. Another change is that automation mode will be enabled by default for SystemTest ProjectStage. With this, we reduce the necessity of defining the automation parameter almost completely.
  • adf-richclient-automation.jar removed from adf.oracle.domain.webapp.war file This is done to segregate test runtime features like Selenium WebDriver and remove it from application runtime. Test runtime features are available with "Oracle Extended Selenium" plugin for JDeveloper.
  • Following public APIs are removed which were inadvertently added previously
    • public constants for matchmedia in oracle.adf.view.rich.context.AdfFacesContext(e.g. static public final String MEDIA_FONT_SIZE = "Font-Size";)
    • AdfPage.prototype.getUnmatchedPropertyValues
    • AdfPage.prototype.setUnmatchedPropertyValues
    • AdfPage.prototype.getMediaQueryListeners
    • AdfPage.prototype.setMediaQueryListeners
    • AdfPage.prototype.getMediaQueryListenerHandler
    • AdfUIComponent.prototype.destroy
  • Performance improvements to ChooseDate and inputDate components The new version af:chooseDate component will no longer post back to the server to refresh the wall calendar. Refreshing the calendar display upon switching year and month is now handled within the client.
  • ChooseDate and inputDate components custom css state changed The af:chooseDate and af:inputDate components originally used a custom adf css state of :empty for specifying the empty, or transparent, color swatch box. Because :empty is a valid css3 state, the custom adf css state for this has been updated to :transparent. Please see the skin selector documentation for more information.
  • Deprecated remote region context parameter: oracle.adf.view.rich.remote.PRODUCER_STYLESHEET_DEBUG_LEVEL Context parameter oracle.adf.view.rich.remote.PRODUCER_STYLESHEET_DEBUG_LEVEL, which controls amount of skin debug information logged is deprecated and will be purged in the next release. The functionalities that depend on the parameter, will default to "verbose" behavior in future releases.

New_in_this_Release

Framework

  • Testing harness for application testing

    Introduced a new testing harness that can be used in conjunction with an automated testing engine in order to simplify automated application tests. A testing engine can be setup to use this testing harness. The testing harness will complete necessary setup before a simulated action occurs. The testing harness will complete the following actions in preparation of a mouse action. 1) If a menuBar or toolbar item is currently in overflow, it will first open the overflow before the simulated action on the item occurs. 2) If a simulated action is received on a menu item, the testing harness will first open the menu (and submenus) needed for that menu item to be displayed before the simulated action on the menu item occurs.

    Note that menus may have lazy content, in which case their content is not present on the page at all until that menu is explicitly opened. Before benefitting from the test harness opening menus as needed, the menu lazy content will need to be retrieved. To allow this, we have added API methods to the menu component. For a menu that has lazy content, the show() method will retrieve that content, and must be called before any simulated actions on child menu items. The isContentLoaded() API method will inform if menu content is loaded or not, to help determine when show() is needed.

  • Window Manager Configuration

    Aspects of window manager behaviors can now be configured by way of Java APIs in addition to web.xml configuration. See oracle.adf.view.rich.context.WindowManagerContext JavaDoc for API and context-param details.

New Components

Change Persistence

Drag and Drop

Input

  • New component - af:inputSearch

    The inputSearch component uses REST service to fetch the list of suggestions. The component filters and displays the suggestions, highlighting the matched portion of each suggestion. The component allows usage of client side templating to customize the presentation of the suggestions.

    The rendering of the component and submission of value happens through the JSF lifecycle. Only the suggestion list is fetched using the REST service.

  • Calendar supports additional header text

    Developers can use the DateCustomizer to specify additional text that will appear in the header of Calendar date cells. For example, developers can specify "New Year's Day" for Jan 1 and it will appear under the current date in the Day view. For a list of keys to override in the DateCustomizer, see the tag doc.

  • Calendar supports resizing of all-day and timed activities region in day and week views

    Calendar component now has a splitter separating the all-day and timed activities region. Users can expand/collapse the splitter to show/hide all-day activities or drag the splitter to resize the two regions. App developers can control the splitter using the new attributes: splitterCollapsed and splitterPosition. Please refer af:calendar tag documentation for detailed information on the two attributes.

  • Calendar supports color coded date cells

    Developers can specify certain date cells within the Calendar to be color coded by providing an inline style using the DateCustomizer. For example, developers can return a specific background color for dates which are holidays.

    For accessibility, developers should also expose the information provided by color coding in an alternate area of the date cell. To that end, the Calendar component now also supports a facet, dateHeaderStamp, which can be used to specify components that will be displayed in the date cell header. For example, if the date is color coded because it is a holiday, developers can specify an af:image with the shortDesc set to the holiday name, as well as programmatically specify which date it should display for, and the image will be displayed in the header for that date.

    For more information, see the javadoc for DateCustomizer and the Calendar tagdoc description of the facet.

  • Calendar supports duration based activities

    A new calendar activity identified by CalendarActivity.TimeTtpe.DURATION has been introduced. This allows developers to model tasks, i.e. activities with a fixed time cost but no predetermined start and/or end time.

    Just like time and all-day activities, duration activities can span multiple days. By default the calendar will render TimeType.DURATION activities in the all-day region alongside all-day activities. The display of duration activities can be controlled using the newly introduced showActivityTypes attribute. As an additional benefit, the attribute showActivityTypes also selectively turns on or off all-day and timed activity regions in day and week views.

    For more information, see the javadoc for CalendarActivity and calendar tagdoc description of showActivityTypes attribute.

  • NumberConverter supports attribute to set rounding behavior

    The numberConverter has a new attribute, roundingMode, which controls how the converter rounds numbers. The attribute is EL-bindable and can be set to a java.math.RoundingMode value or to a String corresponding to the enum value.

    Additionally, the trinidad-config.xml configuration file supports a parameter <rounding-mode> which is also EL-bindable or accepts string values corresponding to the enum. This controls the default rounding behavior of numberConverter instances within the application, when they do not have their roundingMode attribute set.

    If neither the converter attribute nor the config parameter is set, the number converter will retain its previous behavior, that is described in JDK class DecimalFormat.

  • InputComboboxListOfValues supports pre-fetching of dropdown list

    A new attribute contentDelivery has been added to af:inputComboboxListOfValues. Legal values for this attribute are immediate, lazy and lazyUncached. lazyUncached is the default behavior.

    When contentDelivery is "immediate", the dropdown popup content is inlined into the ListOfValues component. If contentDelivery is "lazy", the dropdown popup's content will be delivered to the client only after the first request to show the popup. If contentDelivery is "lazyUncached", the dropdown popup's content will be delivered fresh each and every time the popup is shown.

  • AutoSuggestBehavior supports setting minimum number of characters the user must type before a search is performed

    A new attribute "minChars" is available on the autoSuggestBehavior tag. Filtering of suggestItems and displaying the filtered suggestItems will now happen only when the configured minimum character limit is reached. Set to higher value than 1 if the search could match a lot of items.

    For the smartList however, since the data is available on the client, filtering and display of data will continue to happen even before the limit set is reached.

    The default value of this new attribute is "1" for backward compatibility purpose.

  • AutoSuggestBehavior support in automation: API to retrieve the suggested selectItems

    For automation testing, the suggestions for the current value of the input widget can be retrieved by invoking getSuggestedItems API on the instance of AdfAutoSuggestBehavior JS object. The getSuggestedItems method returns an array of AdfSelectItem. Selection can be simulated by setting the selectItem's value on the client component. e.g. var selectItems = inputComp.getBehaviors(AdfAutoSuggestBehavior).getSuggestedItems(inputComp); inputComp.setValue(selectItems[0].getValue());

  • Support for the applet html tag has been removed from the RichTextEditor due to security issues

    It has been determined that the applet tag (no longer supported in HTML 5) presents a security risk so support has been removed from the RichTextEditor. The iframe attribute 'srcdoc' is no longer supported for security issues.

Layout

  • Attribute childCreation added -

    The childCreation attribute has been added to af:showDetail, af:showDetailHeader, af:panelBox and af:panelAccordion. This attribute will allow the deferring of the creation of children components until the component may be disclosed. The setting will only function for non-stamped components and only defers the creation of subclasses of UIXComponent. The implementation for these components allows the non-component tags to be executed (like listener tags) regardless of the disclosure state as well as allowing the facets to be created that are rendered when the parent component is undisclosed.

  • Attribute iconDelivery added to support inline svg -

    The iconDelivery attribute has been added to af:showDetailItem component. Only ancestor components af:panelSpringboard and af:panelTabbed will support this attribute. If the attribute value is "inline" and the value of icon attribute is a valid svg icon, the icon will be rendered as <svg> tag. For all other cases, the icon will continue to render as <img> tag.

  • Attribute viewportBottom added to panelStretchLayout

    In some cases, you might have a component (like an af:table) in a flowing (e.g. scrollable) container and below the table is an area of empty space before the end of the browser's viewport. If you want the table to stretch to fill up that empty vertical space, the best plan forward is to change that component structure to be stretchable. However, as a temporary solution, you can now wrap that table with a panelStretchLayout and use its new viewportBottom attribute. The table would need to be stretchable (no autoHeightRows setup), the panelStretchLayout must be set to explicitly use dimensionsFrom="parent", and optionally styleClass="AFStretchWidth". With this setup, the height of the panelStretchLayout will resize such that if all the scrolling was at their origins, then the distance from the bottom of that panelStretchLayout to the bottom of the viewport will match the number of pixels (CSS px units) in the viewportBottom attribute; your table will then resize to consume that empty space. The reason why it is not recommended to use this attribute for a long-term solution is because the user will see the table show up at an initial size and once measurements can be taken, will be resized. If the page structure was designed to be stretchable in the first place, the user would not see this adjustment take place.

    Example code:

    <af:panelGroupLayout id="scroller" layout="scroll">
  <af:panelStretchLayout id="wrapper" styleClass="AFStretchWidth"
    dimensionsFrom="parent" viewportBottom="64">
    <f:facet name="center">
      <af:table ...>...</af:table>
    </f:facet>
  </af:panelStretchLayout>
</af:panelGroupLayout>
  • Swipe gesture support for af:deck on touch devices

    On devices that support touch, Deck supports navigating between the child components by swipe gesture if the transition types for forwardNavigate and backNavigate are horizontal (start, end, left or right) and in opposite directions (e.g. if forwardNavigate is left, backNavigate should be right). Deck queues DisplayChangeEvent on swipe based navigation.

MenuBar

Navigation

  • Attribute iconDelivery added to support inline svg -

    The iconDelivery attribute has been added to af:link and af:commandImageLink components. If the attribute value is "inline" and the value of icon attribute is a valid svg icon, the icon will be rendered as <svg> tag. For all other cases, the icon will continue to render as <img> tag.

Output

  • OutputFormatted supports header tags h1 to h6 -

    The outputFormatted tag now allows header tags, e.g. <h1> Heading One </h1>. Since header components like panelHeader also generate header tags for accessibility, developers should also check that the heading level in the outputFormatted appears in correct order relative to parent header components.

  • NumberConverter supports attribute to set rounding behavior

    The numberConverter has a new attribute, roundingMode, which controls how the converter rounds numbers. The attribute is EL-bindable and can be set to a java.math.RoundingMode value or to a String corresponding to the enum value.

    Additionally, the trinidad-config.xml configuration file supports a parameter <rounding-mode> which is also EL-bindable or accepts string values corresponding to the enum. This controls the default rounding behavior of numberConverter instances within the application, when they do not have their roundingMode attribute set.

    If neither the converter attribute nor the config parameter is set, the number converter will retain its previous behavior, that is described in JDK class DecimalFormat.

Query

  • Attribute childCreation added -

    The childCreation attribute has been added to af:showDetail, af:showDetailHeader, af:panelBox and af:panelAccordion. This attribute will allow the deferring of the creation of children components until the component may be disclosed. The setting will only function for non-stamped components and only defers the creation of subclasses of UIXComponent. The implementation for these components allows the non-component tags to be executed (like listener tags) regardless of the disclosure state as well as allowing the facets to be created that are rendered when the parent component is undisclosed.

  • Placeholder text for input components in Query and QuickQuery Panel

    Query and QuickQuery component now support adding placeholder text to input fields in its panel. The value returned by AttributeDescriptor#getPlaceholder API is used for setting placeholder text on input components.

ListView

  • Auto hiding scrollbar feature available for listview component

    "-tr-overflow-style" skinning property has been added to af|listview selector. Setting the property "-tr-overflow-style: autohiding-scrollbar" will hide the scrollbar for listview and show the scrollbar only on mousehover.

Table

  • New API available on carousel component

    The carousel component has a new scrollToRowIndex() method that can be called directly to scroll the carousel to a desired rowIndex. Please see the Javascript documentation for full details.

Region Tabs (PanelTabbed and NavigationPane of type tabs)

Skinning

Table

Tabs (PanelTabbed and NavigationPane of type tabs)

  • Vertical PanelTabbed uses conveyor belt

    If you have a vertical panelTabbed component that is stretched and is vertically larger than its container, then conveyor belt buttons will be displayed to allow access to all of the available tabs. A panelTabbed component in a flowing container will not show conveyor belt buttons, as it's content flows down the page.

ADS Data Formatting

  • Component formatter is used based on following options

    These options are used as values to the context-param(oracle.adf.view.rich.ads.USE_COMPONENT_FORMATTER) in web.xml

    • NEVER

      Never use the component's converter

    • IF_MODEL_DID_NOT_FORMAT

      Only use the component's converter if the new raw and formatted value from the ActiveModel are identical

    • ALWAYS

      Always use the component's converter if it implements FormatterFactory and returns an non-null Formatter

New_in_previous_12.1_releases

New Components

  • Deck

    The deck component is a container that shows one child component at a time. When changing which child is displayed, the transition can be animated with a transition configured via af:transition children tags.

New_in_previous_12.1_releases

New_in_12.1.2

New Components

  • Deck

    The deck component is a container that shows one child component at a time. When changing which child is displayed, the transition can be animated with a transition configured via af:transition children tags.

  • PanelDrawer

    The panelDrawer control can be used to display a group of showDetailItems. Drawer "handles", aka tabs, represent the showDetailItem children. Selecting a tab/handle opens the drawer and displays the associated showDetailItem. Whether a drawer is open is controlled by the disclosed attribute on the showDetailItem children. If none of the children are disclosed, the drawer is "closed" and it's normally shown as attached to the side of a container.

  • PanelSpringboard

    The panelSpringboard control can be used to display a group of contents that belongs to a showDetailItem. An icon strip with icons representing the showDetailItem children along with the item's contents are displayed when in strip mode, and an grid of icons with no contents shown is displayed in grid mode. When the user selects an icon while the panelSpringboard is in strip mode, the panelSpringboard discloses the associated showDetailItem. When the user selects an icon while the panelSpringboard is in grid mode, this automatically causes the panelSpringboard to display in strip mode.

Drag and Drop

  • Tap and hold component drag and drop on touch devices -

    On touch devices, like the tablets, the component drag and drop has a different gesture than with the mouse. An item that can be dragged must activated by a tap and hold gesture. The item will change its appearance to indicate that it can be dragged once held long enough. The same gesture applies to reordering table columns. Tap and hold the column header, then drag it to reorder the columns.

Automation

  • Added client side API to determine if Automation is enabled -

    A new method on AdfPage, isAutomationEnabled(), can be called to determine if automation is currently enabled for this application server. This is a javascript client side API and would be used like: 

      if (AdfPage.PAGE.isAutomationEnabled())
  {
    // automation.ENABLED setting is true
  }
  • Added client side API to determine if css selectors are uncompressed -

    A new method on AdfPage, areCssSelectorsUncompressed(), can be called to determine if the application server is rendering uncompressed css selectors in our generated html for our components. Css selectors are required to be uncompressed for some automation frameworks, such as QTP and OATS. This is a javascript client side API and would be used like:

      if (AdfPage.PAGE.areCssSelectorsUncompressed())
  {
    // .DISABLE_CONTENT_COMPRESSION setting is true.
  }
  • Poll Events can be disabled in Automation Mode

    To prevent interacting with stale/invisible/unavailable elements while testing caused due to partial/full page refresh because of af:poll, polling can be disabled at application level based on the value of the following property within adf-faces-config element of adf-config.xml 

      <automation-testing-config>
    <asynchronous-updates>onDemand<asynchronous-updates>
  </automation-testing-config>
    The default value of 'asynchronous-updates' property is "on". If set to "onDemand", polling will be disabled.

    Poll events can also be disabled by setting Java System property -Dautomation-testing-config.asynchronous-updates=onDemand. This system property will override the value set in adf-config.xml

    Poll Events can be queued on demand using the WebDriver API 'applyAsynchronousUpdates()'. This API will queue all the poll events that would have been queued had polling not been disabled. If there are multiple events on same af:poll component, then only a single event will be queued.

    Along with this support, a client side API getAsynchronousUpdatesState() has been introduced on AdfPage to determine the state of asynchronous updates. This API could be used like: 

      if (AdfPage.PAGE.getAsynchronousUpdatesState() == "onDemand")
  {
    // logic when <asynchronous-updates> is set to "onDemand"
  }
  • PanelDrawer

    The panelDrawer control can be used to display a group of showDetailItems. Drawer "handles", aka tabs, represent the showDetailItem children. Selecting a tab/handle opens the drawer and displays the associated showDetailItem. Whether a drawer is open is controlled by the disclosed attribute on the showDetailItem children. If none of the children are disclosed, the drawer is "closed" and it's normally shown as attached to the side of a container.

  • PanelSpringboard

    The panelSpringboard control can be used to display a group of contents that belongs to a showDetailItem. An icon strip with icons representing the showDetailItem children along with the item's contents are displayed when in strip mode, and an grid of icons with no contents shown is displayed in grid mode. When the user selects an icon while the panelSpringboard is in strip mode, the panelSpringboard discloses the associated showDetailItem. When the user selects an icon while the panelSpringboard is in grid mode, this automatically causes the panelSpringboard to display in strip mode.

Drag and Drop

  • Tap and hold component drag and drop on touch devices -

    On touch devices, like the tablets, the component drag and drop has a different gesture than with the mouse. An item that can be dragged must activated by a tap and hold gesture. The item will change its appearance to indicate that it can be dragged once held long enough. The same gesture applies to reordering table columns. Tap and hold the column header, then drag it to reorder the columns.

Automation

  • Added client side API to determine if Automation is enabled -

    A new method on AdfPage, isAutomationEnabled(), can be called to determine if automation is currently enabled for this application server. This is a javascript client side API and would be used like: 

      if (AdfPage.PAGE.isAutomationEnabled())
  {
    // automation.ENABLED setting is true
  }
  • Added client side API to determine if css selectors are uncompressed -

    A new method on AdfPage, areCssSelectorsUncompressed(), can be called to determine if the application server is rendering uncompressed css selectors in our generated html for our components. Css selectors are required to be uncompressed for some automation frameworks, such as QTP and OATS. This is a javascript client side API and would be used like:

      if (AdfPage.PAGE.areCssSelectorsUncompressed())
  {
    // .DISABLE_CONTENT_COMPRESSION setting is true.
  }
  • Poll Events can be disabled in Automation Mode

    To prevent interacting with stale/invisible/unavailable elements while testing caused due to partial/full page refresh because of af:poll, polling can be disabled at application level based on the value of the following property within adf-faces-config element of adf-config.xml 

      <automation-testing-config>
    <asynchronous-updates>onDemand<asynchronous-updates>
  </automation-testing-config>
    The default value of 'asynchronous-updates' property is "on". If set to "onDemand", polling will be disabled.

    Poll events can also be disabled by setting Java System property -Dautomation-testing-config.asynchronous-updates=onDemand. This system property will override the value set in adf-config.xml

Framework

  • Script Partitioning Support for Tablets -

    Added the ability to segregate touch and desktop specific JavaScript code. This feature allows the framework to alter behavior based on agent capabilities. A new "touchScreen" capability was added to the trinidad agent. The "touchScreen" capability has three enumerations: "none", "single", "multiple". The same capabilities map is now published by the client AdfAgent. The "touchScreen" capability is also available to the implicit agent object that is resolved by evaluating EL that defines the <feature-class> node in the XML file for declaring what source files are featured in individual script partitions.

    Consider: 
      <feature-class>
    ${(agent.webkit and agent.capabilities['touchScreen'] ne 'none') ?
      'oracle/adfinternal/view/js/agent/safari/AdfSafariMobileAgent.js' :
      null}
  </feature-class>
  • Redistributing Touch Events for Tablets -

    For tablet devices that support touch screens and do not have a mouse, the browser simulates some mouse events but not always. In order to achieve functional equivalency for these platforms, client components need to be broadcast touch events. A new touch event object AdfComponentTouchEvent will be made available to components when agents support single or multiple "touchScreen" capabilities. Component peers can conditionally register for touch event handling using the same mechanism.

    Consider: 
      AdfDhtmlPanelSplitterPeer.InitSubclass = function()
  {
    // Register event handlers specific to touch devices
    AdfRichUIPeer.addComponentEventHandlers(this,
                     AdfComponentTouchEvent.TOUCH_START_TYPE,
                     AdfComponentTouchEvent.TOUCH_END_TYPE,
                     AdfComponentTouchEvent.TOUCH_MOVE_TYPE);
  };
  AdfDhtmlPanelSplitterPeer.prototype.HandleComponentTouchMove =  function(componentEvent) {...}
  AdfDhtmlPanelSplitterPeer.prototype.HandleComponentTouchStart = function(componentEvent) {...}
  AdfDhtmlPanelSplitterPeer.prototype.HandleComponentTouchEnd =   function(componentEvent) {...}
  • Simulating Context Menu and Tooltip Activation from Touch Gestures for Tablets - Webkit on IOS and Android platforms do not raise contextMenu events. Under the desktop platform the contextMenu event is derived from the right mouse click. The tooltip is also not supported by these platforms. For desktop browsers the tooltip is shown on mouse over of elements that have a title attribute. Since these tablet devices do not fire contextMenu events or show tooltips, we have added an enhancement to simulate this event from touch gestures. The default gesture is tap+hold (500ms). However, this gesture is also used to active component drag-and-drop. To resolve this conflict, in the cases where drag-and-drop behaviors exist for a component, the context menu and tooltip will be activated on tap+hold+finger-up. Only single finger gestures can be used to active context menus and tooltips.
  • Disabling Loading Splash Screen - ADF Faces displays a "loading" splash screen for each user on the first access to any ADF Faces application in order to provide some feedback while various resources (eg. JavaScript libraries) are loaded. Such feedback might not be desirable in all cases. As of this release, the splash screen can be disabled by setting the oracle.adf.view.rich.SPLASH_SCREEN context parameter to off.
  • Content Delivery Networks - ADF Faces provides a minimal uri rewriting solution that can be used to apply prefixes to resource (eg. JavaScript, style sheet, image) uris. This feature is targeted at public facing applications that wish to improve performance by delegating resource delivery to a content delivery network (CDN). Resource uri prefixing rules are specified centrally in the adf-config.xml file and can be applied both to application-defined as well as ADF-provided resources. See the "ADF Faces Configuration" appendix of the Oracle Fusion Middleware Web User Interface Developer's Guide for details.
  • Session Timeout Alert Dialog - The session timeout warning feature was added in the sherman release. This feature gives the opportunity to extend the session. A warning confirmation dialog is displayed before the session expiration. A period of seconds is configured via the "oracle.adf.view.rich.sessionHandling.WARNING_BEFORE_TIMEOUT" context-param. If the session is not extended, a final alert dialog is displayed notifying of the timeout. When this dialog is shown, the content in the page underneath the dialog will no longer be visible. This is a new security feature.
  • af:target tag - ADF Faces provides a new af:target tag that provides a declarative way to allow a component to specify the list of targets it wants executed and/or rendered when an event (supported by that component) is raised by the component. This feature provides fine-grained control over which components will get executed and which will get rendered. Currently the 'partialTriggers' attribute controls both. Finally the 'partialTriggers' attribute will continue to work as it does today.
  • Framebusting Param Changes - The framebusting context param 'oracle.adf.view.rich.security.FRAME_BUSTING' has been deprecated in favor of the trinidad param. Please change your web.xml to use 'org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.security.FRAME_BUSTING' instead. The legal values are 'always', 'never', and 'differentOrigin'. If you were setting the value of 'oracle.adf.view.rich.security.FRAME_BUSTING' to 'differentDomain', then please note that you should set 'org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.security.FRAME_BUSTING' to 'differentOrigin'.
  • Skinning changes - '.AFFormComponentOutlineFatal:alias' is now derived from '.AFFormComponentOutlineError:alias'. This is because, ADF Faces implementation uses the same styles for both aliases. Considering that most custom skins would not change the styles between these two aliases, skinners job is now easy. They just need to override 'AFFormComponentOutlineError:alias', and it gets reflected in 'AFFormComponentOutlineFatal:alias' and all the selectors that use this alias. Only in case they want the fatal and error styles to be different, would the skinners need to override both the aliases.
  • Disabling the Compatibility View Alert Dialog - ADF Faces displays an alert if users have Internet Explorer configured to run the application in the "compatibility view" mode. This alert asks the users to disable it so that the application will run reliably and in a supported manner. Such feedback might not be desirable in all cases. As of this release, the alert can be disabled by setting the oracle.adf.view.rich.HIDE_UNSUPPORTED_BROWSER_ALERTS context parameter to IECompatibilityModes. Even if these alerts are hidden, a warning-level log message will still be reported to the client logger (such a message will be logged if the oracle.adf.view.rich.LOGGER_LEVEL context parameter is set to WARNING or more verbose).
  • Overriding compatibility mode in IE - ADF Faces is not supported in IE browsers running in compatibility view mode. We have enhanced the agent detection logic to use the trident version in the user agent string over the browser version. The framework forces the target document to the maximum document mode supported by the browser using the X-UA-Compatible META tag. This applies to desktop browsers in compatibility view mode and also applications that use the IE WebBrowser component to host content within desktop applications.

Group (inside Toolbar, MenuBar, PanelFormLayout)

  • Poll Events can be queued on demand using the WebDriver API 'applyAsynchronousUpdates()'. This API will queue all the poll events that would have been queued had polling not been disabled. If there are multiple events on same af:poll component, then only a single event will be queued.

    Along with this support, a client side API getAsynchronousUpdatesState() has been introduced on AdfPage to determine the state of asynchronous updates. This API could be used like: 

      if (AdfPage.PAGE.getAsynchronousUpdatesState() == "onDemand")
  {
    // logic when <asynchronous-updates> is set to "onDemand"
  }

Framework

  • Script Partitioning Support for Tablets -

    Added the ability to segregate touch and desktop specific JavaScript code. This feature allows the framework to alter behavior based on agent capabilities.
