This applies to desktop browsers in compatibility view mode and also applications that use the IE WebBrowser component to host content within desktop applications.

Group (inside Toolbar, MenuBar, PanelFormLayout)

  • Group has new attributes: startBoundary, endBoundary, and title

    The group component now has a startBoundary, endBoundary, and title attributes. StartBoundary and endBoundary have valid values show/hide/dontCare, with a default value of dontCare. Title allows freeform text. What these attributes do is depenedent upon the container rendering the group (remember that group does not render on its own, but only based on parent container). In a toolbar, menuBar, or panelFormLayout, depending on the startBoundary and endBoundary settings, group boundaries may be shown or hidden. With a panelFormLayout, the group title will display along with the group boundary when the title attribute is used.

    Please see the group, toolbar, menuBar and panelFormLayout tag documentation files for detailed informationa about this new feature.

Input

  • Thai Buddhist Calendar Support

    The inputDate, chooseDate and calendar components now support the Thai Buddhist calendar. The behavior can be seen by setting the browser locale to th_TH. When the locale is set to th_TH, dates will be displayed in Buddhist Era-based year numbering.In Buddhist Era, year 1 corresponds to BCE (BC) 543 (Julian). Therefore, Gregorian year + 543 is the B.E. year value. The RCF components only support users picking from Buddhist year 2484 onward - if earlier years are picked, the behavior is not defined.

    For more information, see the JDK Supported Calendars documentation.

  • Added InputDate support for customizing TimeZone list

    The inputDate component now allows developers to supply a custom list of timezones using the timeZoneList attribute. The timeZoneList attribute should be bound to a List of valid TimeZone IDs which will be used to populate a dropdown selection list when inputDate is configured to show timezones. If not specified, InputDate will continue to display a default list of 139 timezones.

    For more information, see the InputDate tag documentation.

  • Added EL method for displaying customized TimeZone list

    An EL method, getCustomTimeZoneSelectItems, has been added. It takes a custom list of timezone IDs and an optional timezone ID and returns a List of SelectItems for the IDs.

    For more information, see the EL methods section of the tag documentation.

  • selectBooleanCheckbox can now function as a tri-state checkbox

    The selectBooleanCheckbox has a new attribute, nullValueMeans, to tell the component how to treat the null value. If nullValueMeans='null' (the default), the component will function as a boolean checkbox. If nullValueMeans='mixed', then the renderer will treat the null value as the third state. This state is only accessible programatically. User interaction with the checkbox will not switch the value to 'mixed'. If the current value is null, clicking on the checkbox will set the value to selected.

  • placeholder attribute support for html5 browsers.

    The following components will support the placeholder attribute when rendered in at html5 browser: inputColor, inputComboboxListOfValues, inputDate, inputListOfValues, inputNumberSpinbox, inputText. At the time of this release, the browsers that support the placeholder attribute are: Firefox verions 4.0 or later, Safari and Chrome. All other browsers we support are not html5 and will ignore this attribute.

  • usage attribute added for some input components.

    The usage attribute is used to specify the html5 'search' input type on some input components. Legal values are: 'auto', 'text' and 'search'. The default is 'auto' (which for now, is the same as text but allows for future improved conditional type selection). The following components will support the usage attribute when rendered in at html5 browser: inputColor, inputComboboxListOfValues, inputDate, inputListOfValues, inputText. At the time of this release, the browsers that support type="search" are: Firefox verions 4.0 or later, Safari and Chrome although only the desktop version of Safari and Chrome add a clear text icon. All other browsers we support are not html5 and will ignore this attribute.

  • animationInterval attribute added for inputNumberSlider and inputRangeSlider.

    The animationInterval attribute is used to specify the amount of time in miliseconds to wait before proceeding to the next value when animated. If the value of the attribute is greater than zero, then a play button will be rendered below the slider component. Clicking on the play button will start the animation of the slider, pausing for the number of miliseconds specified at each increment of the slider. When animated, clicking on the button again will stop the animation. When the value reaches the maximum value, animation will stop. If the component is the target of a PPR, animation will stop.

  • Support for resizing of search and select dialog of inputListOfValues and inputComboboxListOfValues components.

    The resizing of the search and select dialog of lov components is turned on and the application developers can turn off the feature by defining the following skinning key in their custom skin. The skinning is set to true by default in Fusion skin. 

    af|inputComboboxListOfValues{
    -tr-stretch-search-dialog: false;
  }
  af|inputListOfValues{
    -tr-stretch-search-dialog: false;
  }
  • A new attribute, searchDialog is added for InputComboboxListOfValues

    The searchDialog attribute accepts "none" and "default" as valid values, "default" is the default behavior. Setting the searchDialog attribute to "none" will remove the "Search..."/"More..." link from the dropdown popup and suppresses the default Search and Select dialog functionality of af:inputComboboxListOfValues.

Layout

  • Override default dimensions -

    By default, certain components default to getting their dimensions from the parent. This makes these components harder to work with in flowing containers, where the desire is usually to get the dimensions from the preferred size of the children components. In order to support this, but still maintain backwards compatibility, we have introduced a new web.xml context parameter. This parameter, when set, will allow the default values of certain attributes to assume a value that fits their current container. For the dimensionsFrom attribute, this means that the default value will be "auto" instead of "parent". This has the affect that the component will determine from its parent component what dimensions to use by default. This affects the dimensionsFrom attribute on af:decorativeBox, af:panelAccordion, af:panelDashboard, af:panelStretchLayout, af:panelSplitter and af:panelTabbed.

    For the table family of components, af:table, af:tree and af:treeTable, setting the new context parameter to auto will result in the default value of autoHeightRows to be switched from -1 to 0. Also, the these components will renderer the AFStretchWidth style class when autoHeightRows is 0 (and the context parameter has been set to auto).

    In order to set this new parameter, you must add this to the web.xml of your application:

      <context-param>
      <description>
        This parameter controls the default value for component geometry on the page.
        Supported values are:
          legacy - component attributes use the default values as specified for the attributes
                   in the tag documentation (default value)
          auto   - component attributes use the correct default value given the value of their
                   parent component. For example, with this setting, the panelStretchLayout
                   will use "auto" as the default value for its "dimensionsFrom" attribute
                   instead of "parent".
      </description>
      <param-name>oracle.adf.view.rich.geometry.DEFAULT_DIMENSIONS</param-name>
      <param-value>auto</param-value>
    </context-param>
  • New panelGridLayout, gridRow, gridCell components -

    A new layout container component named "panelGridLayout" has been added. It uses one or more gridRow components to describe the rows of a grid layout structure. Each row defines a height and margins. Each gridRow uses one or more gridCell components to describe the cells for columns in that row of the grid layout structure. Each cell defines width, margins, column span, row span, horizontal alignment, and vertical alignment.

  • New skinning property and key for af|showDetail -

    A new skinning property of -tr-layout has been added to the af:showDetail component. A child-container skinning-key has also been added. Please see the skin selectors documentation for their descriptions.

  • PanelHeader and ShowDetailHeader have new headerLevel attribute -

    PanelHeader and ShowDetailHeader have a new headerLevel attribute. This attribute allows the default HTML header level (H1 through H6) of the header component to be overridden, and have the provided header level value used instead.

  • Conveyor belt support for tabs in a compressed layout

    Conveyor belt is a new option for managing tabs in a compressed layout. This option is available for af:panelTabbed and af:navigationPane (hint=tabs) components. The default compressed layout mode for these components is overflow. These components have a new skinning property of -tr-layout-type that can be set to 'overflow' (the default) or 'conveyor'. When set to conveyor, the component will use the new conveyor belt mode when content is compressed (not enough horizontal space to display all tabs). Conveyor belt consists of buttons to scroll content left or right, as well as a droplist button that shows all available tabs.

    For more information about conveyor belt compressed layout mode, please see the af:panelTabbed and af:navigationPane tag documentation, as well as the skinning documentation for these components.

ListView

  • Added a new ListView component that displays a List of Items based on rows of a collection model. If the ListView component is bound to a TreeModel and a "groupHeader" facet is specified, the ListView shall display group header areas (with or without disclosure). Each group header shall contain a set of list Items.

Navigation

  • New single button component

    There is now a new af:button component that replaces all former button components (af:goButton, af:commandButton, af:commandToolbarButton, and af:activeCommandToolbarButton). The new af:button contains all of the features of the former button components. For example, the new af:button contains both a destination and action attribute. When the destination is set, it behaves like the former af:goButton. When the action is set, it behaves like the former af:commandButton.

    For more information about af:button, please see the af:button tag documentation. With this change, the af:goButton, af:commandButton, af:commandToolbarButton, and af:activeCommandToolbarButton are now deprecated - you should start using the new af:button component instead.

    Two new values for iconPosition attribute have been added- namely top and bottom. af|button skin selector now has four additonal pseudo classes: leading, trailing, top, bottom. Also now there is no restriction on maximum height of button, although minimum height is 19px.

  • New single link component

    There is now a new af:link component that replaces all former link components (af:goLink, af:commandLink, af:goImageLink, and af:commandImageLink). The new af:link contains all of the features of the former link components. For example, the new af:link contains both a destination and action attribute. When the destination is set, it behaves like the former af:goLink. When the action is set, it behaves like the former af:commandLink. Now it also has a 'selected' attribute which applies a skin property to distinguish a selected link on a page.

    For more information about af:link, please see the af:link tag documentation. With this change, the af:goLink, af:commandLink, af:goImageLink, and af:commandImageLink are now deprecated - you should start using the new af:link component instead.

Output

Calendar

  • Customize Toolbar Date Range String

    The DateCustomizer allows for per date customizations, there is now a new method formatRange on the DateCustomizer in order to support customizing the toolbar date range string. New keys passed to the DateCustomizer.format method are

    • "af|calendar::toolbar-display-range:day": in day view, or in list view when listType=day, customize the date range string on the toolbar
    • "af|calendar::toolbar-display-range:month": in month view, or in list view when listType=month, customize the date range string on the toolbar
    New keys passed to the DateCustomizer.formatRange method are
    • "af|calendar::toolbar-display-range:week": in week view, or in list view when listType=week, customize the date range string on the toolbar
    • "af|calendar::toolbar-display-range:list": in list view when listType=daycount, customize the date range string on the toolbar

  • Specify Order of All Day Activities

    A new attribute, allDayActivityOrder, can be used to customize the order in which all day activities are displayed.

    Activities can have tags, which are stored on the Activity as a Set of String values. The allDayActivityOrder attribute specifies a List of String values that will be used to order the display of all day activities. For example, if allDayActivityOrder = "holiday absence", activities tagged "holiday" will display on top, followed by activities tagged "absence", then followed by other all day activities (activities with different tags, or untagged activities).

  • Support all calendar views in printable mode

    All calendar views (day, week, month, list) are rendered in printable mode.

    Calendar supports wysiwyg printing. Earlier behavior was to print calendar always in list view irrespective of the view from which print was requested.

Popup

  • Changes to the showPopupBehavior tag - The popupId attribute is now required by the showPopupBehavior tag. There was inconsistent behavior between JSP and Faceletes for this tag in regards to the popupId. Now, for both page declaration types (JSP and Facelets), the popupId is required at design-time and run-time. A new "disabled" attribute was added to the showPopupBehavior tag to allow for conditional activation of this client behavior. The default value of the new disabled attribute is "false". All attributes of the showPopupBehavior tag now supports deferred EL expressions. Previously only the popupId provided EL value binding but now the align, alignId, triggerType and disabled attributes can be EL bound.
  • Additional button skinning selectors added to the af:dialog component - The dialogs "type" property controls pre-configured buttons not provided in the buttonBar facet. More specific selectors were added to allow skinning the three categories of buttons:
    • "Yes", "OK": af|dialog::footer-button-affirmative
    • "No": af|dialog::footer-button-no
    • "Cancel": af|dialog::footer-button-cancel

Query

  • The new functionality to "duplicate" a saved search in the Personalize Saved Search dialog has been added to the Query component. This feature enables users to clone an existing "saved search" and edit its name and other properties.
  • New Attribute - "runQueryAutomatically" Allows page authors to specify at component level if the query should be run automatically for saved searches.
  • New Attribute - "saveResultsLayout" Allows page authors to specify at component level if the query should automatically save the results layout. By default the results layout is saved by the query. If the value is set to "never", ChangeManager will save the layout of the results component and the saved changes will apply to all saved searches.

    There is also an application level setting (oracle.adf.view.rich.query.SAVE_RESULTS_LAYOUT=never) to turn off saving of the results layout. This can be set in the web.xml for the web application.

  • Prompt User for unsaved searches and results layout changes Following are changes implemented by this ER:
    • Results layout are now saved and updated even for system searches.
    • After the user reorders/resizes columns and clicks on search, user is prompted for changes in the results layout. Clicking on "Yes" will persist the changes and "No" will not. Both options will still allow user to perform the search.
    • Switching the saved search will also prompt the user to save the results layout (if changed).
    • Copy/Duplicate action will not prompt the user since it is a "save as" action. The new saved search will persist the new results layout.
    • Update/Override operation will automatically persist the results layout.
    • Delete operation will throw away the saved search and hence nothing needs to be done.
    • Leaving the page (by going to google.com) will invoke the dirty data message.
    • In addition to tracking that the results layout is changed, a saved search is also tracked for being dirty. So the user is prompted when fields are added and removed in the saved search. The prompt is done on a search or saved search switch operations, similar to the prompt for results layout changes.

Skinning

  • New Skyros Skin

    • Skin Description

      A new skin with an updated and modern appearance, called 'Skyros', is now available. Visually the skin is flat, clean, and crisp, and incorporates current UI visual design trends. While look and feel have changed, the size of components in the Skyros skin have not changed, which allows existing applications with Fusion skins to be reimplemented with Skyros skin without requiring layout updates.

      The Skyros skin takes advantage of modern skinning techniques (CSS3). For example, it uses CSS rounded corners instead of the image borders used in previous skins. It also uses CSS gradients for coloring instead of background images. These changes results in a smaller footprint for the skin, with far less images being delivered to the browser than previous skins.

      The Skyros skin has been developed for use with the JDeveloper Skin Editor from the ground up, resulting in a skin that is easy to customize. In Skyros, colors have been organized into related anchor and derivative groups, making large color customizations easy to do via the Skin Editor.

    • Getting the Skyros Skin

      When creating a new application, the Skyros skin is now the default.

      For an existing application with it's own custom skin that extends a Fusion skin, you will need to edit your trinidad-skins.xml file. In trinidad-skins.xml, you will change your custom skin to extend Skyros instead, by changing the extends line to a value of 'skyros-v1.desktop'.

      For an existing application that uses (but doesn't extend) a Fusion skin, you will need to edit your trinidad-config.xml file. In trinidad-config.xml, your currently selected skin is identified by 'skin-family' and 'skin-version'. Set the skin-family to be 'skyros' and the skin-version to be 'v1'.

    • Things to be Aware of When Updating to Skyros Skin

      If you have a custom skin and are looking to have your custom skin now extend Skyros, you will need to review your custom skinning keys to see if they apply to the Skyros skin. The same applies for any custom JavaScript or custom components.

      A common mistake is having incorrectly specified height and width values set via the inlineStyle attribute. If you have problems like this in your application, they may result in layout problems in the Skyros (or other) skins.

      If you are using the decorativeBox component with a navigationPane hint=tabs in the top facet, the topHeight attribute should be set via EL to the navigationPane's -tr-tab-bar-height skinning value ('af|navigationPane-tabs-tr-tab-bar-height'). In order to do this, you will need to have a registered JavaBean that retrieves the tab bar height. Here is an example: 

        public class MyBean
  {
    public String getNavigationTabBarHeight()
    {
      if (_cachedTabBarHeight == null)
      {
        Skin skin = RenderingContext.getCurrentInstance().getSkin();
        Object height = skin.getProperty("af|navigationPane-tabs-tr-tab-bar-height");
        _cachedTabBarHeight = height.toString();
      }
      return _cachedTabBarHeight;
    }
    private String _cachedTabBarHeight;
  }

      With this bean in place, you can set your decorativeBox topHeight attribute using: topHeight="#{myBean.navigationTabBarHeight}". By defining your topHeight this way, your top facet will be the correct size, regardless of which skin you use.

      Note that if you are moving an existing app over from the Fusion skin to the Skyros skin, you may have problems with navigationPane hint=tabs in a decorativeBox top facet. If the decorativeBox topHeight is hard coded (not using EL like above) then your tabs will appear about 4px above the decorativeBox content. You will need to follow the instructions above so that your tabs are compatible with the Skyros skin.

Tabs (PanelTabbed and NavigationPane of type tabs)

  • Tab remove icons display differently in version 3 of the fusionFx skin

    The visibility of tab remove icons has been changed in the version 3 fusion skin. When remove functionality exists for a disclosed tab, the tab remove icon is always visible, where it used to only be visible on mouse over. When remove functionality exists for an undisclosed tab, the tab remove icon is visible upon hover anywhere over the tab, where it used to only be visible on mouse over directly over the icon itself. Also, now when a tab gets focus via the tab key, the tab remove icon is displayed. As before, you can remove a tab via the keyboard by pressing Ctrl Alt F4.

    In addition, we have introduced the following new aliases to belp simplify skinning of tab remove icons: .AFTabRemoveImageDisclosed:alias, .AFTabRemoveImageUndisclosed:alias, .AFTabRemoveImageActive:alias, .AFTabDisabledRemoveImage:alias, .AFTabRemoveImageDisabledDisclosed:alias, and .AFTabRemoveImageDisabledUndisclosed. For more information about these aliases, please refer to the skinning selectors documentation.

Table

  • Row Header Faces Messages Icon - When the table or treeTable has designated a column as a rowHeader (rowHeader="true"), the table and treeTable components will display an icon in the row header column representing the maximum severity of component level faces messages for that particular row. This feature applies to both normal and screen reader modes.
  • table/treeTable support copy/paste of text data - Browser based text selection within a table/treeTable is now enabled on all browsers. The components provide visual cues to the user when hovering over text and non-text areas to indicate the affordances - for e.g., hovering over readonly text displays the text cursor. In addition drag and drop inside a table row(s)is only available when the drag originates in an area that does not contain text or other editable components.
  • Export - Export functionality (af:exportCollectionActionListener tag) are enhanced:
    • Two new attribute values for exportedRows: 'allWithoutDetails' and 'selectedWithoutDetails'. These two attribute values can be used to suppress exporting data from disclosure region.
    • Exporting to CSV files is now supported
    • Application developer can now use filterMethod and filterName to override default export behavior. Please refer to tag doc and dev guide for more details.
  • New Editting Behavior in click-to-edit Table - The user clicks on a cell to get to Edit mode (single click to edit is preserved). While in Edit mode, the content inside the cell is highlighted without cursor focus, and:
    1. If the user presses Right/Left Arrow keys, the content highlight disappears. The text insertion point now appears and navigates within the content of this cell. If the user clicks on the cell again or presses F2, the insertion point is placed behind the last character (or anywhere user clicks). If user presses Right/Left Arrow keys, the insertion point navigates within the content of this cell.
    2. If the user presses the Esc key, the current cell's content changes are canceled. The cell and its row returns directly to Read-only mode.
    3. Tab and Enter key behaviors remain unchanged as before.
  • Alternate Content navigation on Tablet - On IOS and Android devices, the content is navigated using a paging control vs scrollbar on desktop browsers.
  • Added 2 new attributes to the varStatus:
    • "hierarchicalIndex" - returns an array containing zero based row index.
    • "hierarchicalLabel" - returns a string label representing 1 based index of this row.
  • Case Insensitive Sort Support - Case insensitive sort is now supported with a new column property sortStrength. By default, table column sorting is case sensitive. When sortStrength is set to Primary or Secondary, sort becomes case in sensitive.
  • Column Span Support - Added new attribute colSpan to control the number of columns a cell should span. Default is 1. If set to "ALL", the column spans all the cells toward the end.
  • Paging Support - Added new attribute scrollPolicy to table/treeTable control the paging mode. Possible values are: page, scroll, and auto. 'auto' means it depends on the device, on desktop we will use 'scroll', and on touch devices we will use 'page'. Default is 'auto'.
  • Model Driven Filtering Support - Table Filtering can now be completely model driven

    The Table component supports filtering of data through filter fields on the top of the column headers. To support filtering, "filterModel" attribute needs to be bound to and instance of FilterableQueryDescriptor class. In addition any column that wants to support filtering must have filterable="true" set along with the sortyProperty="...". The "sortProperty" attribute is the key for the filter field in the model.

    For the filtering to be model driven, ConjunctionCriterion object returned form FilterableQueryDescriptor#getFilterConjunctionCriterion method must not be null. The components created for filter fields is based on model component type meta-data. However the column "filter" can be used to override the default functionality defined at the model layer. 

                <af:table ...
                    filterModel="#{bindings.EmpView1Query.queryDescriptor}"
                    queryListener="#{bindings.EmpView1Query.processQuery}"
                    ...>
            <af:column sortProperty="Empno" filterable="true" ...>
              ...
            </af:column>
            <af:column sortProperty="Hiredate" filterable="true" ...>
              <f:facet name="filter">
                <af:inputDate value="#{bindings.EmpView1Query.queryDescriptor.filterConjunctionCriterion.criterionMap.Hiredate.value}" id="id1"/>
                  <af:convertDateTime timeZone="#{myPrefs.timeZone}" pattern="#{myPrefs.pattern}"/>
                </af:inputDate>
              </f:facet>
              ...
            </af:column>
            ...
          </af:table>

    Please note that use of varstatus ("vs") property to map values from filterCriteria is deprecated since the completely model driven approach provides similar functionality.

Tree

  • Added 2 new attributes to the varStatus:
    • "hierarchicalIndex" - returns an array containing the row indices of hierarchy of the current row, for e.g. [0,1,2].
    • "hierarchicalLabel" - returns a string label representing the hierarchy of that row, for e.g. 1.1, 1.1.1. The labels are 1 based vs 0 based for rowIndex.

PanelCollection

  • Hide/Show Multiple Columns Hide/Show multiple columns of a table is enhanced to improve user experience. When there are 3 or more columns are available in the table, "Manage Columns..." menu item will show up to allow user to hide/show multiple columns in one batch. Note that when column grouping is enabled for table, this feature is turned off.

ForEach

  • Map and CollectionModel Support and EL Enhancements The for each tag has been enhanced with support for both map and collection model items values. With these changes, the EL processing in the tag has also been enhanced. These changes allowed key based collections to be flexible to permit collection changes between requests. The demo application has been updated to show how to use the for each tag to handle changes properly.

Known_Bugs_and_Limitations

  • Browser specific bugs
    • IE9 inputComboboxListOfValues in table or treeTable

      - The af:inputComboboxListOfValues component will not function properly inside of table or treeTable components.

    • IE7, IE8, IE9 layout components

      - In some layout components, images in the af:commandImageLink component are clipped. Application Developers can fix this by setting the styleClass="AFLinkIEWorkaround" element on the af:commandImageLink tag.

    • IE7 nested table elements

      - If you have nested table elements and an input element with % width, the input field grows when you type into it (Oracle IE7 bug 9869651).

    • IE7 inputFile component

      - The af:inputFile component allows the user to type in the name of a file. This can cause problems if the file does not exist. For reasons like this, IE8 does not allow the end-user to type in the filename.

    • IE10 Select Choice component

      - Due to a bug in IE10, the select choice component does not open up the selection list until focusing on another UI control first then focus on the select choice component (Oracle IE10 bug 16046192).

    • Firefox 3 Access Keys

      - Access keys do not work properly on the af:inputFile component (Bugzilla bug 554099), and on the af:selectManyShuttle and af:selectOrderShutle components in screenreader mode (Bugzilla bug 554104). The workaround is to use tab key instead to access the component.

    • Firefox 3 Enter key in the Rich Text Editor

      - Pressing the Enter key in the Rich Text Editor's text field loses the selected font name because of a Firefox queryCommandValue bug (Bugzilla bug 409788).

    • Firefox 2

      - The cursor is not visible on text fields in popup or table components Bugzilla bug 226933). There are several other rendering issues in Firefox 2 that are fixed in Firefox 3. Mozilla no longer supports Firefox 2, so we are unable to get any fixes for that browser from them. We recommend that if customers run into rendering issues on Firefox 2 that they move to Firefox 3.

    • Desktop Safari 3

      - The af:richTextEditor component does not function properly in WYSIWYG mode (Webkit bug 7138), many keyboard shortcuts do not work properly.

    • Google Chrome

      - When users press Ctrl-N or Ctrl-T to launch multiple Chrome browser windows and then copy the URL to bring up pages with active data, active data doesn't work correctly (Oracle bug 8309340).

    • IE browser, Rich Text Editor

      - IE doesnot support links in contentEditable or designMode ,this is browser limitation , Due to this issue the hyperlinks will not work properly in RTE in IE7 , IE8, IE9.

  • Accessibility: Column Headers for Total/Subtotal Cells (6931494)
    ADF Faces users can typically produce accessible table content by specifying column headers for every column in their af:table. However, in certain complex cases, such as when the af:table contains total or subtotal rows, the cell containing the labels for these rows may be inappropriately associated with the containing column's column header. For example, assuming a column contains employee names and has the header text "Employee Name", a cell containing the text "Total" will be inappropriately identified to screen reader users as being an "Employee Name". In order to avoid confusion, such cells should not be associated with any column header. ADF Faces does not provide any mechanism for suppressing column headers for such cells.
  • Accessibility: Keyboard Selection Request Frequency (6238722)
    When interacting with an af:table, af:tree, or af:treeTable, using the up/down arrow keys to change the selection can result in a round trip to the server. ADF Faces already optimizes to reduce the number of round-trips by only sending a single request at a time, and also by dropping requests for intermediate selection states that occur while a request is outstanding. However, in some cases keyboard users may find the current behavior inefficient, since a request is sent to the server as soon as the request queue frees up. Ideally, no request would be sent until after the user has reached the item that they intend to select - ie. until after the user has paused keyboard activity for some short period of time.
  • Accessibility: ProgressIndicator reading by JAWS in Firefox
    The af:progressIndicator component will not be read by JAWS in Firefox. It is due to a JAWS bug.
  • Active Data Service (6926281)
    If Active Data Service is enabled in an application, there are certain ADS pages (/adwwls/wls.ads and adw.jspx) should not be cached. If Oracle Web Cache runs for the application, need to add cache rule to exclude pages with name of /adwwls/wls.ads or adw.jspx.
  • ADF Faces Stamped Components with MDS
    ADF Faces components do not support persisting customization changes to MDS if the component is contained inside of (anywhere in the subtree of) af:forEach or af:iterator tags. This limitation is because, while such structure results in multiple component copies in the view tree, they have a single representation in the jsp documents.
  • Application View Cache (6495920)
    The Application View Cache won't work for any page where the rendering of the component tree causes the structure of the component tree to change temporarily. Since this is often the case and the application developer has no way of telling when this will occur, USE_APPLICATION_VIEW_CACHE should never be used. It also only helps initial render performance and does not help the session size.
  • Browser specific bugs
    See the browser specific bugs listed in the Supported Platforms section.
  • Calendar Binding data type support
    Due to the lack of support in model to convert data of type java.util.Date to java.sql.Date, a runtime error will occur if java.sql.Date is specified as NDType in the calendar page definition file. Please use the supported types instead:
    • oracle.jbo.domain.Timestamp
    • oracle.jbo.domain.Date
    • java.sql.Timestamp
    • java.util.Date
  • convertDateTime may not work with pattern "MMM" on Websphere Application Server (WAS)
    On IBM JDK deployments (WAS), date patterns which contain 3 or more letters for the month, e.g. 'MMM' may fail, e.g. on locale 'zh_HK' it fails with a Javascript parse error even though the user has not modified the value. This is tracked as bug 14088506.
  • convertDateTime does not work with dateStyle="full"and locale="th_TH" or "ja_JP_JP"
    When the dateTimeConverter is used with dateStyle="full" and Thai Buddhist (th_TH) or Japanese Imperial (ja_JP_JP) locales, a Javascript error will be thrown even if the date is valid. This is tracked as bug 12861287.
  • convertNumber does not work with type="percent" and locale="tr_TR"
    When convertNumber is used with type="percent" and locale="tr_TR", a Javascript error will be thrown even if the number is valid. This is tracked as bug 13006484.
  • Dialog Framework, new browser window, and RTL Locale (12630300) -

    Bug 12630300 identified a layout issue with IE version 9 and greater, Microsoft SR 111072584108293. This issue is further isolated to the use of the dialog framework launching a new browser window and only when the locale is RTL. This SR is targeted for IE10 but it is unknown yet if it will make this release. As a workaround the .AFDialog-tr-enable-ie-rtl-toggle skinning property key can be used to enable a workaround. This workaround is not implicitly activated. It must be enabled in a custom skin. Consider: @agent ie and (version:9) { .AFDialog { -tr-enable-ie-rtl-toggle: true; } }

  • Emailable Page
    The table component has some known issues in emailable page mode.
    • The Total/Subtotal rows of the table are not bold in Outlook (8554509). The application developer would need to define the bold style directly on their outputText.
    • The detailStamp, if disclosed, does not render as disclosed in emailable page mode in both Thunderbird and Outlook (8868756).
    • columnStretching is not supported in emailable mode since this happens in javascript and javascript is not supported by email agents (8827678). You need to set the width attribute on the af:column components.
    • The column footers will not format correctly in Outlook if the td has its html width attribute set. This could happen if you wrap your footer in a panelGroupLayout, so take care to test on Outlook and if your footer isn't aligning correctly, then check the rendered html to see if the td has width set on it, and if so, try to change the layout so it is not set.
  • GlassFish Logging Error Message - NoClassDefFoundError: weblogic/servlet/http/AbstractAsyncServlet
    When application is deployed to GlassFish application server, user may see the following error message in server log file:
    Error in annotation processing:
    java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: weblogic/servlet/http/AbstractAsyncServlet
    This error message can be ignored.
  • Hot Keys
    Application developers must be cautious when assigning access keys to menus. Hot keys may be intercepted by various browsers or even the operating system. One such hotkey, ALT-D, will send focus to the address bar in both IE and FireFox 2. For this hotkey, we have removed the references in our demos. But many more hotkeys may be restricted so it is a good idea to try them out on all of your supported browsers.
  • Primary Keys from Model (6894412)
    In previous releases, ADF Faces components expect applications to use primary keys on the model data objects that are pre-populated for new records and do not change with any record updates. This limitation has been removed from the current release except for the case where the affected row is not in UI range while its key is changed programatically in a backing bean.
  • Profiler File Logger The profiler file logger can be used only in a non-portal environment on FF and IE browsers with at least 1.5._06 JRE on the client box and privilege to write to the user home dir. The resulting file format is subject to change without any notice and not intended to be used with any xml parser tool. In order to use the feature, the user has to accept the certificate.
  • RichText Editor Error Messages (11686814)
    It is recommended that the application developer add a validation rule for situations where the Error Message returned by the RichText Editor would include the text contained in the RichText Editor and that text may be large enough to not be properly displayed by the browser.
  • RichText Editor on Tablet devices
    • If the rows attribute is not specified then the editable area of the RichText Editor in RichText Editing Mode will grow with the content added. Therefore, when running on tablet devices, please make sure the component is configured with the rows attribute defined.
    • Once the user clicks on the editable area the keyboard opens up. Clicking outside the editable area (such as the toolbar buttons) will then close the keyboard. In addition, the cursor position will not be retained upon clicking back on the editable area.
    • On all versions of iOS any touch event listeners added to the document are disabled when the editable area of the RTE has focus and are added back again on blur. This is due to iOS bug http://openradar.appspot.com/radar?id=2527401. Therefore, if you have manually added any touch event listeners to the document, please make sure you have used the ADF API AdfAgent.addBubbleEventListener() to do so. That way your touch event listeners are removed and restored properly.
    • af:clientListener can be used with RichText Editor to listen to keyboard events. However, on tablet devices the key modifiers in the keyboard events will not be valid due to browser limitations.
  • Sub-Id support for Code Editor for testing
    • The code editor uses the hidden text area in its implementation and its a webdriver and selenium limitation that developer cannot type or set a value on hidden field.
    • To set the value for the codeEditor content webdriver api can be used "setRichComponentProperty(locator,"value","somevalue");" where locator will be id of codeEditor component
  • Skinned Icons Resize (10058868)
    Until recently there were limitations with skinning icons that -tr-rule-ref and -tr-inhibit were not supported. Further, the skin properties were not inherited from base skin for icon selectors. We fixed these limitations to make the icon selector behavior consistent with general skinning style selectors. Now that we inherit the skin properties for icons, if there were 'content' and other properties like 'width' and 'height' set, and you override just the 'content' property in your custom skin, you would inherit the 'width' and 'height' from the base skin. While this is a change in behavior, it is a change in right direction. If this behavior is not desirable, skinners can use -tr-inhibit to inhibit some properties or 'tr-inhibit: all' to inhibit all properties before overriding the 'content' property.
  • StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in org.apache.myfaces.trinidadinternal.style.util.CSSGenerationUtils (9400134) This error happens due to bug http://bugs.sun.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=6875866 (HotSpot compiler bug in String.indexOf() using SSE4.2 instruction-set on new Intel chips). Workaround: Add this line to the JVM options: -XX:-UseSSE42Intrinsics then remove the cached CSS file, e.g., $APP_TMP_FOLDER/public/adf/styles/cache/blafplus-desktop-ezog8j-en-ltr-gecko-1.9.1.8-cmp.css. restart WLS, clear your browser cache and everything should be working. Please note that the bug should be fixed with jdk6.18b02 but we see it on 6.18b07
  • Trinidad app and New Window Detection (8677612)
    New Window Detection logic only works in Rich Client applications, but not in Trinidad appliations. For Trinidad applications, the following parameter should be added in web.xml to disable New Window Detection logic. 
                <context-param>
                <param-name>oracle.adf.view.rich.newWindowDetect.OPTIONS</param-name>
                <param-value>off</param-value>
            </context-param>
  • User Activity Monitoring and Browser Support
    • Because of a limitation in the IE userData persistence behavior, the userActivity data for previous requests may be partially or sometimes completely unavailable when accessed from pages with a different URL than was used when the page was originally saved. In IE 5 and later, data stored using IE userData persistence is accessible only to web pages within the same directory and on the same domain. This means that a webpage in a sub folder though part of the same origin cannot access the data persisted by a page in its ancestor folder (8809021). Additionally when IE userData persistence is disabled, client-side tracking of user activity data will be unavailable (it's recommended that the Oracle RUEI feature be explicitly disabled in this case).
    • In Safari when a user goes into Private Browsing mode, user activity monitoring will be disabled and as a result no user activity data will be reported. The reason for this is because the DOM sessionStorage object is unavailable as for storing any data and attempts to set a value on it throws an error (14368121).
  • User Activity Monitoring and Client-side Redirects (13610257)
    PPR requests that result in a client-side redirect now include in its resposne headers 2 new parameters - Adf-Location and Adf-Status-Code. Adf-Location points to the redirected URL as determined by the server, but the URL may change as determined by the client PPR Navigation logic. So the actual page user is redirected to might not actually be the one in Adf-Location.
  • User Specified Window Names
    In this release we start to support user specified window names. A user can launch a window and give it a name, and we will continue to use that name if it's valid. Currently the supported character set for window name is : [a-z][A-Z][0-9]_
  • InputFile component in multiple file upload mode using IE When an InputFile component configured to support multiple file upload is used with IE with Java enabled, the following settings must be set.
    • In the IE security level for the zone, the option "Include local directory path when uploading files to the server" must be enabled.
  • InputFile component in multiple file upload mode using Java 7
    When an InputFile component configured to support multiple file upload is used with Java 7, security level for Java Control panel must be set to Medium or lower.
  • Supported browsers for InputFile component in multiple file upload mode Multiple file upload is supported on all release supported browser versions. However, there are a few features of InputFile in multiple upload mode which are dependent on Browser version and Java applet support.
    Browser Version Java Applet Supported Features
    Drag and Drop Progress Bar Chunked File Upload for files greater than 2GB
    IE All release supported versions Yes Yes Yes Yes
    IE All release supported versions No No No No
    FireFox All release supported versions Yes Yes Yes Yes*
    FireFox v5 and newer No Yes Yes Yes
    FireFox Older than v5 No No No No
    Chrome All release supported versions Yes Yes Yes Yes*
    Chrome v10 and newer No Yes Yes Yes
    Chrome Older than v10 No No No No
    Safari All release supported versions Yes Yes Yes Yes*
    Safari v5.1 and newer No Yes Yes No
    Safari Older than v5.1 No No No No
    *Only for files added through Drag and Drop
  • CodeEditor Limitations on iOS
    • CodeEditor does not support text selection and Copy/Paste on iOS.
  • Keyboard navigation in Table For navigation using the Enter key to work the Table must have rowHeader set.

Help

Please see the FAQ for help.
